item.title: ‚ÄúIn practical terms, the expanded policy gives ICE officers...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

‚ÄúIn practical terms, the expanded policy gives ICE officers more power to determine who can be quickly deported, although it‚Äôs unclear exactly how fast the process will be.
The shift could allow the Trump administration to increase deportations while circumventing a court system that is severely backed up and short on resources, but advocates for immigrants have said it would destroy their due process rights.‚Äù #ChingaLaMigra #AbolishICE

The new policy will give agents the ability to arrest and deport undocumented immigrants without a hearing in front of a judge.

buzzfeednews.com

ICE Is Planning To Fast-Track Deportations Across The Country

The new policy will give agents the ability to arrest and deport undocumented immigrants without a hearing in front of a judge.The new policy will give agents the ability to arrest and deport undocumented immigrants without a hearing in front of a judge.

item.title: Abolish ICE DenverNo More Deaths/No M√°s MuertesA trail cam inside Byrd Camp captured a few photos of the raid Monday night before Border...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE DenverNo More Deaths/No M√°s Muertes

A trail cam inside Byrd Camp captured a few photos of the raid Monday night before Border Patrol agents knocked over a pile of supplies, blocking its view. This... was the SECOND nighttime raid in recent months at the humanitarian aid station. 12 people were arrested.

Border Patrol, with BORTAC, stormed the camp in full tactical gear, with night vision goggles and guns drawn.

For 3 hours, a helicopter buzzed overhead, kicking up plumes of dust & terrorizing the migrants they chased & arrested in the darkness. This is a particularly insidious tactic BP uses to frighten & disorient people. It often results in death and disappearance.

It's called "dusting" and it happens everyday in the desert.

See More
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: "While they continue to create a crisis of death and...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"While they continue to create a crisis of death and disappearance in the desert, we're going to continue to try to offer humanitarian aid," Taleb said.

Tucson Sector agents arrested 12 undocumented immigrants and temporarily detained seven volunteers during another raid of Byrd Camp in Arivaca.

azcentral.com

Border Patrol raids No More Deaths camp near Arivaca for 2nd time in 3 months

Tucson Sector agents arrested 12 undocumented immigrants and temporarily detained seven volunteers during another raid of Byrd Camp in Arivaca.Tucson Sector agents arrested 12 undocumented immigrants and temporarily detained seven volunteers during another raid of Byrd Camp in Arivaca.

item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Good riddance! üéªüéª

‚Äú‚ÄòNinety percent of my department wants to leave. They want to leave for the same reasons I outlined in my letter to city council. They don‚Äôt feel appreciate by the community anymore. They don‚Äôt feel appreciated by city council anymore, there‚Äôs protests every single weekend, there‚Äôs people spitting on us, calling us all kinds of bad names.‚Äô

He said when protestors took over District 1 on July 3 was when he made up his mind to retire early. ‚ÄòThe city thinks their First Amendment right is more important than my life.‚Äô‚Äù

item.title: *Sigue en espa√±ol* In the past couple of days we have received...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

*Sigue en espa√±ol*

In the past couple of days we have received alarming news of a COVID-19 outbreak at the GEO detention facility in Aurora. Initially 19 positive cases of COVID-19 were reported Friday evening. After getting in touch with folks inside of the facility our community organizers found out about two additional cases. GEO has shown they cannot keep our community who is detained safe before and during this pandemic. Join us for a car caravan tomorrow at 5 pm to show... your solidarity. Bring signs and decorate your cars!

We are calling on the release of all detained folks under humanitarian parole and medical attention to folks who have tested positive or have been exposed.

What can you do to help:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Call ICE and demand the release of folks on humanitarian parole
(720) 873-2899

2Ô∏è‚É£ Call warden Johnny Choate and demand that he provides proper medical care to those in need
(303) 361-6612

3Ô∏è‚É£ Sign up to be a volunteer for COPA's Detention lifeline

En los √∫ltimos d√≠as, hemos recibido noticias alarmantes de un brote de COVID-19 en el centro de detenci√≥n de GEO en Aurora. Inicialmente, se informaron 19 casos positivos de COVID-19 el viernes por la noche. Despu√©s de ponernos en contacto con la gente dentro de las instalaciones, los organizadores de nuestra comunidad se enteraron de dos casos adicionales. GEO ha demostrado que no pueden mantener a salvo a nuestra comunidad detenida antes y durante esta pandemia. √önete a nosotros para una caravana de autom√≥viles ma√±ana a las 5 pm para mostrar tu solidaridad. ¬°Trae letreros y decora tus autos!

Hacemos un llamado a la liberaci√≥n de todas las personas detenidas bajo libertad condicional humanitaria y atenci√≥n m√©dica a las personas que han dado positivo o han estado expuestas.

Qu√© puedes hacer para ayudar:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Llama a ICE y exije la liberaci√≥n de las personas en libertad condicional humanitaria
(720) 873-2899
2Ô∏è‚É£ Llama al alcaide Johnny Choate y exige que brinde la atenci√≥n m√©dica adecuada a los necesitados
(303) 361-6612
3Ô∏è‚É£ Reg√≠strate para ser voluntario de la l√≠nea de vida de detenci√≥n de COPA

See More

THU, OCT 8

CARavan for Our Friends and Families Exposed to COVID at the GEO Detention Center

GEO Aurora Ice Processing Center

¬∑ AuroraCauses
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: The Colorado Rapid Response Network is a network of concerned...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

The Colorado Rapid Response Network is a network of concerned and committed volunteers who respond to ICE activity in our communities. Wednesday, October 7th from 6:00 to 8:00 pm we will train Legal Observers. Join our training to become a LO and learn how to defend our community. REGISTRATION REQUIRED -You will receive Zoom meeting information upon registration here https://us02web.zoom.us/‚Ä¶/register/WN_N3RSvfCoSKaVsWyrNVrc3A

Those already trained as Confirmers, people who c...onfirm ICE activity after a call has been received by the Hotline, will find it helpful to be cross-trained as Legal Observers and vice versa- that way you'll be ready to respond in either role when you get the call from the CO Rapid Response Network Dispatcher.

Legal observers are independent witnesses of ICE behavior and support the legal rights of vulnerable populations. While the focus of this training will be on how to support and observe in case of a raid conducted by immigration authorities, legal observers can apply what they learn in many situations, such as:
* Accompanying immigrants and their families as they attend court dates or ICE check-ins.
* Attending public demonstrations, protests, and other activities where there is a potential for conflict between the public or activists and the police, security guards, or other law enforcement officials.
*******************************************
La Red de Respuesta R√°pida de Colorado es una red de voluntarios preocupados y comprometidos que responden a la actividad de ICE en nuestras comunidades. El mi√©rcoles 7 de octubre de 6:00 a 8:00 pm capacitaremos a los Observadores Legales. √önase a nuestra capacitaci√≥n para convertirse en LO y aprenda a defender nuestra comunidad. Recibir√° informaci√≥n sobre la reuni√≥n de Zoom al registrarse. REGISTRACION REQUERIDA https://us02web.zoom.us/‚Ä¶/register/WN_N3RSvfCoSKaVsWyrNVrc3A

Aquellos que ya est√°n capacitados como confirmadores, las personas que confirman la actividad de ICE despu√©s de que la l√≠nea directa haya recibido una llamada, encontrar√°n √∫til recibir capacitaci√≥n cruzada como observadores legales y viceversa; de esa manera, estar√° listo para responder en cualquier funci√≥n cuando recibe la llamada del despachador de la red de respuesta r√°pida de CO.

Los observadores legales son testigos independientes del comportamiento de ICE y apoyan los derechos legales de las poblaciones vulnerables. Si bien el enfoque de esta capacitaci√≥n estar√° en c√≥mo apoyar y observar en caso de una redada realizada por las autoridades de inmigraci√≥n, los observadores legales pueden aplicar lo que aprendan en muchas situaciones, tales como:
* Acompa√±ar a inmigrantes y sus familias mientras asisten a las fechas de la corte o los registros de ICE.
* Asistir a manifestaciones p√∫blicas, protestas y otras actividades donde existe la posibilidad de conflicto entre el p√∫blico o activistas y la polic√≠a, guardias de seguridad u otros agentes del orden.

See More

WED, OCT 7

Virtual CORRN Legal Observer Training

Online EventCauses
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Via @coloradopeoplesalliance and the Detention Lifeline...
item.content:encoded:
Via @coloradopeoplesalliance and the Detention Lifeline

üö®Community Alertüö®
The Aurora Fire Chief notified council members of a COVID-19 outbreak at the GEO detention facility this afternoon. There are 19 confirmed positive cases! We know we can't count on GEO to keep our community members who are detained safe. We demand that GEO releases as many folks as possible on humanitarian parole and ensures that those who are sick receive the proper medical care! We will keep monitoring the situation and connect with folks inside the facility to ensure their health and safety.

Read our full press release here: https://coloradopeoplesalliance.ourpowerbase.net/civicrm/mailing/view?id=1271&reset=1

üö®Alerta a la comunidadüö®
El jefe de bomberos de Aurora notificó a los miembros del consejo sobre un brote de COVID-19 en el centro de detención de GEO en Aurora esta tarde. ¡Hay 19 casos positivos confirmados! Sabemos que no podemos contar con GEO para mantener seguros a los miembros de nuestra comunidad que están detenidos. Exigimos que GEO libere a la mayor cantidad posible de personas en libertad condicional humanitaria y garantice que los enfermos reciban la atención médica adecuada. Seguiremos al tanto de la situación y nos conectaremos con las personas dentro de las instalaciones para garantizar su salud y seguridad.

Lea nuestro comunicado de prensa completo aquí: https://coloradopeoplesalliance.ourpowerbase.net/civicrm/mailing/view?id=1271&reset=1
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.content:encoded:
"Community showed up on Tuesday afternoon in LoDo to make sure Palantir Tech feels unwelcome in Denver.

Palantir Technologies is ICE’s technology backbone, provides the digital infrastructure to surveil, detain and deport immigrants."

Photos by @buffalo_heart_images
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Conditions are extremely difficult for our @denverpsl comrades inside.Lillian, Joel & Eliza are dealing with...
item.content:encoded: Conditions are extremely difficult for our @denverpsl comrades inside.Lillian, Joel & Eliza are dealing with difficulties accessing medication and sanitary products, serious COVID risks, abuse from guards, and intense stress from isolation (23+ hours a day). Their civil rights are also being violated with Denver, Adams and Arapahoe County working together to deny our comrades a bond hearing. Our comrades suffer yet they are still thinking of others — constantly telling communjty about the conditions of their cell mates and others in the jail and agitating for their release as well. @justiceforelijahmcclain PSL Denver and Say Their Names 5280 are heroes and freedom fighters. And we need to be fighting harder than ever for them. See you Saturday!
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: After the success of last year's "Confront la Migra Where They Live!" house demonstration in the suburban neighborhood...
item.content:encoded:
After the success of last year's "Confront la Migra Where They Live!" house demonstration in the suburban neighborhood of GEO Warden Johnny Choate, @auroragov and APD spent nearly a QUARTER OF A MILLION dollars to police the Enough Coalition march up Colfax to GEO in the following week. In a SINGLE DAY A quarter million dollars were paid out to APD and Adams County officers just to try to intimidate us with fences and riot gear. That day, APD also tried to make our indigenous comrades drop their prayer sticks to enter on Oakland Street and when our comrades told APD, "You're in riot gear and have batons! Let us have our prayer sticks or we are gonna sue the shit out of you!"

Why does APD continue to do private security for Aurora GEO? La policia, la migra, misma porqueria!

Photos by @denvercommunists

#AbolishICE #ChingaLaMigra #closethecamps
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Date: Sunday, September 20th, 2020 from 1-3PM @ Aurora GEO 3130 Oakland St...
item.content:encoded:
Date: Sunday, September 20th, 2020 from 1-3PM @ Aurora GEO 3130 Oakland St

*Please adhere to 6ft social distancing - Wear your masks, bring your hand sanitizer.*

"We'll be highlighting the refugee and immigrant experience of our AAPI communities. We want to peacefully express our concerns about the new ICE Director appointment. Please join us in solidarity!

Asian refugee and immigrant speakers from Chinese, Vietnamese, And Korean backgrounds will provide their powerful stories and perspectives. Immigration advocates and activists will also provide updates on current issues surrounding immigration.

We invite you to sign postcards to express your support for ICE detainees that will be delivered to local legislators.

Please share this event and encourage others to show up and support!"
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Message us for the event link! This series is every Tuesday in person or online until Sept 29!...
item.content:encoded:
Message us for the event link! This series is every Tuesday in person or online until Sept 29!

https://facebook.com/events/s/immigration-is-an-lgbtq-issue-/269755914013547/?ti=cl

Immigration is an LGBTQ Issue: Love Across Borders
TUESDAYS @ 6:30pm • Sept. 8, 15*, 22 & 29

(This event is NOT being held at the Althea Center.)

ONLINE via Zoom to Facebook Live
• Sept. 15*: Only available online on this date.
• Recordings of the series will be posted on YouTube.
OR
ON-SITE (Raíces Brewing, 2060 West Colfax Ave.)
• In-person reservations REQUIRED & limited to first 50 people.

Drinks & Pizza at Raíces Brewing Company starting @ 5:30PM (Reservations required for Raíces)

Zoom Program and live streaming @ 6:30PM

Entertainment produced by Black Actors Guild @ 7:30-8:00PM

Registration: FREE 4-week series!
Please register in advance.
Raíces reservation and program Zoom information emailed with RSVP confirmation.
Immigration Equality shoulder bag for the first 100 registrants.

https://www.altheacenter.org/loveacrossborders

Mariposa at the Althea Center, in partnership with NY-based Immigration Equality and American Friends Service Committee Colorado, will present “Immigration is an LGBTQ Issue: Love Across Borders,” 4-week series of programs highlighting some of the traumatizing circumstances and critical needs of our LGBTQ sisters and brothers seeking asylum in the United States.

With simultaneous Spanish/English interpretation provided for Zoom participants, we will hear powerful and personal migration stories from current and recent LGBTQ asylum seekers. PFLAG Las Cruces, NM, will share their “real life” model of hosting asylum seekers, for which they won an award last year from the national PFLAG organization. We will hear from national and local leaders doing the day-to-day work of assisting and supporting these asylum seekers.

Registration: FREE 4-week series!
Please register in advance.
Raíces reservation and program Zoom information emailed with RSVP confirmation.
Immigration Equality shoulder bag for the first 100 registrants.

https://www.altheacenter.org/loveacrossborders
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Denver Police have killed again! And they won‚Äôt stop until we stop them! On Wednesday, Sept 9, they shot and killed...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Police have killed again! And they won’t stop until we stop them! On Wednesday, Sept 9, they shot and killed Antonio Blackbear, a 41-year-old Lakota man.

Antonio was the adopted cousin of another Lakota man killed by the Denver Police five years ago, Paul Castaway. Indigenous people are more likely than any other racial group to be killed by police.

There has been no semblance of justice for Paul in that time, since Denver District Attorneys, like their counterparts around the nation, refuse to hold police accountable for the violent, racist terror that forms the very core of their job description. We expect the fight for justice for Antonio to be a similarly difficult one.

The police have yet to release video of their killing of Antonio, nor say much about it, because they are working to craft a story that casts them in the best light.

Justice for Antonio Blackbear!
Defund, disarm, and disband the police!
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: We‚Äôve received confirmed reports of one house raid in Fountain, one house raid in Denver and a workplace raid in...
item.content:encoded:
We’ve received confirmed reports of one house raid in Fountain, one house raid in Denver and a workplace raid in Denver.

If police come to your home, remember that you do not need to answer any questions. Ask to speak to an attorney.

Call the @coloradonlg legal line to request an attorney or get information: 720-822-5893

Source:

https://twitter.com/HeidiBeedle/status/1304114344804978688?s=19
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: #FREESZASZA URGENT ACTION STEPS ...
item.content:encoded:
#FREESZASZA URGENT ACTION STEPS

Join us in calling and emailing, Ice Deputy Assistant Director, Jeffrey Lynch,
720- 873-2899

Jeffrey.d.lynch@ice.dhs.gov/Jeff.d.lynch@ice.dhs.gov

Collective Call-In Action 9/10 @ 10am- 12pm MT/ 9am- 11am PST/ 11am- 1pm EST
Script Provided

As you may know, Sza Sza Codner or Jennifer Codner is a Jamaican trans woman detained at Aurora Contract Detention Facility.

Sza Sza endured violence and persecution in her country of origin which drove her to seek asylum and refuge here. Since then she's been ferried from one immigrant prison to the other, subjected to solitary confinement, targeting and harassment from guards, placed in men's facilities, and a host of other horrible atrocities.
Help end her indefinite imprisonment by pushing for her release.

Sza Sza has court this Friday, 9/11 and we are determined to assist in getting her out of detention and towards safety.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver
